user2.value: We are looking for a skilled and experienced Data Engineer with a strong background in Python programming and a deep understanding of Azure services. The ideal candidate will have expertise in various ETL tools and a proven track record in data warehousing. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining Python code for diverse applications and data processes while leveraging Azure services like storage accounts, Azure Data Bricks, Azure Data Factory, Log Analytics, and Synapse. You will implement ETL processes using tools such as Azure Data Factory (ADF), Pyramid Analytics, SSIS, and Alteryx, and design, build, and manage data warehouses. Your responsibilities will also include developing and maintaining databases using SQL Server and Oracle, writing optimized SQL queries, and creating and managing reports through tools like Pyramid Analytics, Power BI, and Tableau. Additionally, experience with data file formats like Avro and Parquet will be essential for this role. The ideal candidate will bring strong coding skills in Python, hands-on experience with ETL tools, and proficiency in advanced SQL development. Familiarity with reporting tools like Power BI and Tableau, along with a solid understanding of database development, is highly desirable. If you are passionate about using your technical expertise to create robust data solutions in a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply.

user2.value: We are seeking a Senior Manager with expertise in the Power & Utilities (P&U) sector, covering areas such as Generation, Transmission, Distribution, Metering, Retail, Customer, and Trading, to join our team and play a key role in the growth of a new service offering. In this role, you will provide consulting services to P&U clients, leading Digital Grid Programs and systems such as ADMS, DMS, OMS, SCADA, and GIS, with a focus on increasing value and efficiency. You will act as an evangelist for Energy Efficiency, driving synergies with Smart Grid Technologies, Distributed Energy Resources, and Electric Vehicle Charging Infrastructure. Additionally, you will stay current on industry trends, provide strategic insights, and contribute to new business development by developing solutions, managing workstreams, and leading client meetings and workshops. Your expertise will also be crucial in supporting business development activities, including go-to-market strategies, project management, and client relationship building. The role requires a deep understanding of the P&U lifecycle, extensive experience in sales enablement and program management, and a solid background in Smart Energy Solutions and Digital Utilities Transformation. The ideal candidate will possess a degree in Electrical Engineering, knowledge of power system modeling standards, and a minimum of 15 years of experience, with at least 10 years focused on the P&U sector. Strong communication, project management, and people management skills, along with a proactive, problem-solving mindset, are essential. This role offers a unique opportunity to shape the future of the P&U sector while working in a dynamic, globally recognized consulting environment.

user2.value: We are looking for a talented and experienced Data Engineer specializing in Generative AI (Gen AI) to join our team. The ideal candidate will have 5-8 years of hands-on experience with Python programming and be well-versed in building scalable, data-driven solutions in cloud environments, particularly with Azure. You should have solid experience in working with REST APIs, Fast APIs, Graph APIs, and SQL Alchemy for efficient data integration and management. A strong understanding of Azure services such as DataLake, Azure SQL, Function Apps, and Azure Cognitive Search is essential for this role. Additionally, you should be familiar with key concepts in Generative AI, including chunking, embeddings, vectorization, indexing, prompting, hallucinations, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG). Experience in DevOps practices, such as creating pull requests (PRs) and maintaining code repositories, is required. You will also be responsible for applying best practices in security and governance for Gen AI frameworks, ensuring compliance and data integrity. Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively within cross-functional teams are key to success in this role. This position offers an exciting opportunity to work on innovative AI projects and contribute to the development of cutting-edge data engineering solutions.

user2.value: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Statistician to join our clinical development team in the pharmaceutical industry. The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years of experience working in clinical development, with a strong foundation in statistics and quantitative methods. You should possess a deep understanding of clinical trial study design, including the application of appropriate statistical methods and the ability to implement simulations using tools such as R and SAS. This role may involve overseeing the statistical deliverables from both internal teams and external partners, such as Contract Research Organizations (CROs), ensuring accuracy and consistency in statistical analysis. Hands-on experience in statistical and programming work is required, as well as a solid knowledge of CDISC standards to ensure data is managed and reported in accordance with industry guidelines. A minimum of a Master's degree in Statistics, Biostatistics, or a related quantitative field is required, though a PhD is preferred. This role offers the opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge clinical trials, applying your expertise to improve the development of new treatments and therapies, while also ensuring the integrity and validity of data throughout the trial process. The position requires strong problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

user2.value: We are seeking a highly skilled and passionate Machine Learning Specialist to join our team, where you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge machine learning projects that push the boundaries of AI technology. In this role, you will apply advanced ML techniques to solve complex problems and drive innovation in specialized domains. Your responsibilities will include transforming data science prototypes, designing machine learning systems, researching and implementing appropriate ML algorithms, and developing applications based on specific requirements. You will be involved in selecting datasets, performing statistical analysis, and fine-tuning models to ensure optimal performance. Additionally, you will train and retrain systems when necessary, extend existing ML libraries, and stay updated on the latest developments in the field. The ideal candidate will have proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or a similar role, a solid understanding of data structures, data modeling, and software architecture, as well as deep knowledge of mathematics, probability, statistics, and algorithms. You should be proficient in programming languages like Python, Java, and R, and familiar with popular ML frameworks such as Keras, PyTorch, and libraries like scikit-learn. Strong communication skills, the ability to collaborate in a team environment, and exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities are essential. A BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field is required, and a Master’s degree is a plus.

user2.value: We are seeking an experienced and proactive Lead Statistician to independently manage and oversee statistical aspects of clinical development projects, with limited supervision. In this role, you will be responsible for leading project teams, developing analysis databases, conducting complex statistical analyses, and generating formatted tables and summaries. You will also play a key role in mentoring junior team members, ensuring that departmental SOPs are followed, and maintaining high-quality project documentation. Key responsibilities include conducting team meetings, managing project timelines, assessing resource needs, and overseeing budgets. You will interact closely with sponsors and work collaboratively with programmers and data management personnel to ensure proper database maintenance and documentation. Additionally, you will provide sample size calculations, review protocols for statistical soundness, and create randomization schemes. You will develop and implement statistical analysis plans, including analysis databases and table specifications, and guide the team in their execution. Hands-on programming skills, especially in SAS® (BASE, STAT, MACRO, and GRAPH), are essential, along with experience in reviewing reports and contributing to the statistical sections of clinical reports. Your role will also involve monitoring the project budget and proactively communicating changes in work scope. A Master's degree in statistics, biostatistics, or a related field is required, with significant experience leading project teams, conducting statistical analysis, and collaborating with cross-functional teams. Strong SAS® programming skills, the ability to mentor and lead teams, excellent project management abilities, and effective communication skills are essential for success in this role.

user2.value: Unified Mentor is offering an exciting internship opportunity for a Data Analyst Intern, providing students and recent graduates with valuable hands-on experience in data analysis. This remote, 3-month unpaid internship will allow you to assist in collecting, cleaning, and analyzing data sets, collaborate with the data analysis team to identify trends and patterns, and contribute to the development of data visualization dashboards and reports. You will also support in creating presentations to communicate findings to stakeholders and have the opportunity to learn and utilize various data analysis tools and techniques. To be eligible, you should be currently enrolled in or recently graduated from a relevant academic program, possess strong analytical skills with attention to detail, and have proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, or Python (preferred but not required). Excellent communication, teamwork skills, and the ability to work independently are essential. Upon successful completion of the internship, you will receive a certificate and a letter of recommendation, along with the possibility of a full-time employment offer based on performance. This internship is a great opportunity to gain hands-on experience, contribute to real projects, and build your professional portfolio.

user2.value: We are actively seeking talented Senior Python Developers to join our dynamic team, dedicated to advancing the field of AI technology. This opportunity is perfect for professionals who are passionate about developing innovative solutions and aspire to be at the forefront of AI developments. As a Senior Python Developer, you will collaborate with various companies across the US, working on both commercial and research-driven AI solutions. Your role will involve writing efficient Python code to solve complex problems, using your business acumen and analytical skills to extract valuable insights from public databases. You will communicate the reasoning and logic behind your code clearly, especially when working in Jupyter notebooks or other appropriate mediums. Extensive experience in Python programming, a deep understanding of the language's syntax and conventions, and a strong background in tackling algorithmic problems are essential. The ideal candidate should also be able to design and implement practical solutions, develop test cases to validate those solutions, and debug and refine their work. While prior experience in Software Quality Assurance and Test Planning is a plus, excellent communication skills—both spoken and written—are a must for collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams. If you are eager to take on challenging projects in AI and machine learning, we encourage you to apply and contribute to our innovative and rapidly growing environment.

user2.value: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Statistician to join our clinical development team in the pharmaceutical industry. The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years of experience working in clinical development, with a strong foundation in statistics and quantitative methods. You should possess a deep understanding of clinical trial study design, including the application of appropriate statistical methods and the ability to implement simulations using tools such as R and SAS. This role may involve overseeing the statistical deliverables from both internal teams and external partners, such as Contract Research Organizations (CROs), ensuring accuracy and consistency in statistical analysis. Hands-on experience in statistical and programming work is required, as well as a solid knowledge of CDISC standards to ensure data is managed and reported in accordance with industry guidelines. A minimum of a Master's degree in Statistics, Biostatistics, or a related quantitative field is required, though a PhD is preferred. This role offers the opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge clinical trials, applying your expertise to improve the development of new treatments and therapies, while also ensuring the integrity and validity of data throughout the trial process. The position requires strong problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

user2.value: We are seeking a highly skilled and passionate Machine Learning Specialist to join our team, where you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge machine learning projects that push the boundaries of AI technology. In this role, you will apply advanced ML techniques to solve complex problems and drive innovation in specialized domains. Your responsibilities will include transforming data science prototypes, designing machine learning systems, researching and implementing appropriate ML algorithms, and developing applications based on specific requirements. You will be involved in selecting datasets, performing statistical analysis, and fine-tuning models to ensure optimal performance. Additionally, you will train and retrain systems when necessary, extend existing ML libraries, and stay updated on the latest developments in the field. The ideal candidate will have proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or a similar role, a solid understanding of data structures, data modeling, and software architecture, as well as deep knowledge of mathematics, probability, statistics, and algorithms. You should be proficient in programming languages like Python, Java, and R, and familiar with popular ML frameworks such as Keras, PyTorch, and libraries like scikit-learn. Strong communication skills, the ability to collaborate in a team environment, and exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities are essential. A BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field is required, and a Master’s degree is a plus.

user2.value: We are seeking an experienced and proactive Lead Statistician to independently manage and oversee statistical aspects of clinical development projects, with limited supervision. In this role, you will be responsible for leading project teams, developing analysis databases, conducting complex statistical analyses, and generating formatted tables and summaries. You will also play a key role in mentoring junior team members, ensuring that departmental SOPs are followed, and maintaining high-quality project documentation. Key responsibilities include conducting team meetings, managing project timelines, assessing resource needs, and overseeing budgets. You will interact closely with sponsors and work collaboratively with programmers and data management personnel to ensure proper database maintenance and documentation. Additionally, you will provide sample size calculations, review protocols for statistical soundness, and create randomization schemes. You will develop and implement statistical analysis plans, including analysis databases and table specifications, and guide the team in their execution. Hands-on programming skills, especially in SAS® (BASE, STAT, MACRO, and GRAPH), are essential, along with experience in reviewing reports and contributing to the statistical sections of clinical reports. Your role will also involve monitoring the project budget and proactively communicating changes in work scope. A Master's degree in statistics, biostatistics, or a related field is required, with significant experience leading project teams, conducting statistical analysis, and collaborating with cross-functional teams. Strong SAS® programming skills, the ability to mentor and lead teams, excellent project management abilities, and effective communication skills are essential for success in this role.

user2.value: Unified Mentor is offering an exciting internship opportunity for a Data Analyst Intern, providing students and recent graduates with valuable hands-on experience in data analysis. Upon successful completion of the internship, you will receive a certificate and a letter of recommendation, along with the possibility of a full-time employment offer based on performance. This internship is a great opportunity to gain hands-on experience, contribute to real projects, and build your professional portfolio.

user2.value: We are looking for a skilled and experienced Data Engineer with a strong background in Python programming and a deep understanding of Azure services. The ideal candidate will have expertise in various ETL tools and a proven track record in data warehousing. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining Python code for diverse applications and data processes while leveraging Azure services like storage accounts, Azure Data Bricks, Azure Data Factory, Log Analytics, and Synapse. You will implement ETL processes using tools such as Azure Data Factory (ADF), Pyramid Analytics, SSIS, and Alteryx, and design, build, and manage data warehouses. Your responsibilities will also include developing and maintaining databases using SQL Server and Oracle, writing optimized SQL queries, and creating and managing reports through tools like Pyramid Analytics, Power BI, and Tableau. Additionally, experience with data file formats like Avro and Parquet will be essential for this role. The ideal candidate will bring strong coding skills in Python, hands-on experience with ETL tools, and proficiency in advanced SQL development. Familiarity with reporting tools like Power BI and Tableau, along with a solid understanding of database development, is highly desirable. If you are passionate about using your technical expertise to create robust data solutions in a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply.

Strong communication, project management, and people management skills, along with a proactive, problem-solving mindset, are essential. This role offers a unique opportunity to shape the future of the P&U sector while working in a dynamic, globally recognized consulting environment.

user2.value: We are seeking an experienced and proactive Lead Statistician to independently manage and oversee statistical aspects of clinical development projects, with limited supervision. In this role, you will be responsible for leading project teams, developing analysis databases, conducting complex statistical analyses, and generating formatted tables and summaries. You will also play a key role in mentoring junior team members, ensuring that departmental SOPs are followed, and maintaining high-quality project documentation. Key responsibilities include conducting team meetings, managing project timelines, assessing resource needs, and overseeing budgets. You will interact closely with sponsors and work collaboratively with programmers and data management personnel to ensure proper database maintenance and documentation. Additionally, you will provide sample size calculations, review protocols for statistical soundness, and create randomization schemes. You will develop and implement statistical analysis plans, including analysis databases and table specifications, and guide the team in their execution. Hands-on programming skills, especially in SAS® (BASE, STAT, MACRO, and GRAPH), are essential, along with experience in reviewing reports and contributing to the statistical sections of clinical reports. Your role will also involve monitoring the project budget and proactively communicating changes in work scope. A Master's degree in statistics, biostatistics, or a related field is required, with significant experience leading project teams, conducting statistical analysis, and collaborating with cross-functional teams. Strong SAS® programming skills, the ability to mentor and lead teams, excellent project management abilities, and effective communication skills are essential for success in this role.

The ideal candidate will bring strong coding skills in Python, hands-on experience with ETL tools, and proficiency in advanced SQL development. Familiarity with reporting tools like Power BI and Tableau, along with a solid understanding of database development, is highly desirable. user2.value: We are looking for a talented and experienced Data Engineer specializing in Generative AI (Gen AI) to join our team. The ideal candidate will have 5-8 years of hands-on experience with Python programming and be well-versed in building scalable, data-driven solutions in cloud environments, particularly with Azure. Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively within cross-functional teams are key to success in this role. This position offers an exciting opportunity to work on innovative AI projects and contribute to the development of cutting-edge data engineering solutions.

user2.value: We are looking for a skilled and experienced Data Engineer with a strong background in Python programming and a deep understanding of Azure services. The ideal candidate will have expertise in various ETL tools and a proven track record in data warehousing. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining Python code for diverse applications and data processes while leveraging Azure services like storage accounts, Azure Data Bricks, Azure Data Factory, Log Analytics, and Synapse. You will implement ETL processes using tools such as Azure Data Factory (ADF), Pyramid Analytics, SSIS, and Alteryx, and design, build, and manage data warehouses. Your responsibilities will also include developing and maintaining databases using SQL Server and Oracle, writing optimized SQL queries, and creating and managing reports through tools like Pyramid Analytics, Power BI, and Tableau. Additionally, experience with data file formats like Avro and Parquet will be essential for this role. The ideal candidate will bring strong coding skills in Python, hands-on experience with ETL tools, and proficiency in advanced SQL development. Familiarity with reporting tools like Power BI and Tableau, along with a solid understanding of database development, is highly desirable. If you are passionate about using your technical expertise to create robust data solutions in a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply.

user2.value: We are seeking a Senior Manager with expertise in the Power & Utilities (P&U) sector, covering areas such as Generation, Transmission, Distribution, Metering, Retail, Customer, and Trading, to join our team and play a key role in the growth of a new service offering. In this role, you will provide consulting services to P&U clients, leading Digital Grid Programs and systems such as ADMS, DMS, OMS, SCADA, and GIS, with a focus on increasing value and efficiency. You will act as an evangelist for Energy Efficiency, driving synergies with Smart Grid Technologies, Distributed Energy Resources, and Electric Vehicle Charging Infrastructure. Additionally, you will stay current on industry trends, provide strategic insights, and contribute to new business development by developing solutions, managing workstreams, and leading client meetings and workshops. Your expertise will also be crucial in supporting business development activities, including go-to-market strategies, project management, and client relationship building. The role requires a deep understanding of the P&U lifecycle, extensive experience in sales enablement and program management, and a solid background in Smart Energy Solutions and Digital Utilities Transformation. The ideal candidate will possess a degree in Electrical Engineering, knowledge of power system modeling standards, and a minimum of 15 years of experience, with at least 10 years focused on the P&U sector. Strong communication, project management, and people management skills, along with a proactive, problem-solving mindset, are essential. This role offers a unique opportunity to shape the future of the P&U sector while working in a dynamic, globally recognized consulting environment.

user2.value: We are looking for a talented and experienced Data Engineer specializing in Generative AI (Gen AI) to join our team. The ideal candidate will have 5-8 years of hands-on experience with Python programming and be well-versed in building scalable, data-driven solutions in cloud environments, particularly with Azure. You should have solid experience in working with REST APIs, Fast APIs, Graph APIs, and SQL Alchemy for efficient data integration and management. A strong understanding of Azure services such as DataLake, Azure SQL, Function Apps, and Azure Cognitive Search is essential for this role. Additionally, you should be familiar with key concepts in Generative AI, including chunking, embeddings, vectorization, indexing, prompting, hallucinations, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG). Experience in DevOps practices, such as creating pull requests (PRs) and maintaining code repositories, is required. You will also be responsible for applying best practices in security and governance for Gen AI frameworks, ensuring compliance and data integrity. Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively within cross-functional teams are key to success in this role. This position offers an exciting opportunity to work on innovative AI projects and contribute to the development of cutting-edge data engineering solutions.

user2.value: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Statistician to join our clinical development team in the pharmaceutical industry. The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years of experience working in clinical development, with a strong foundation in statistics and quantitative methods. You should possess a deep understanding of clinical trial study design, including the application of appropriate statistical methods and the ability to implement simulations using tools such as R and SAS. This role may involve overseeing the statistical deliverables from both internal teams and external partners, such as Contract Research Organizations (CROs), ensuring accuracy and consistency in statistical analysis. Hands-on experience in statistical and programming work is required, as well as a solid knowledge of CDISC standards to ensure data is managed and reported in accordance with industry guidelines. A minimum of a Master's degree in Statistics, Biostatistics, or a related quantitative field is required, though a PhD is preferred. This role offers the opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge clinical trials, applying your expertise to improve the development of new treatments and therapies, while also ensuring the integrity and validity of data throughout the trial process. The position requires strong problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

A BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field is required, and a Master’s degree is a plus.

user2.value: We are seeking an experienced and proactive Lead Statistician to independently manage and oversee statistical aspects of clinical development projects, with limited supervision. In this role, you will be responsible for leading project teams, developing analysis databases, conducting complex statistical analyses, and generating formatted tables and summaries. You will also play a key role in mentoring junior team members, ensuring that departmental SOPs are followed, and maintaining high-quality project documentation. Key responsibilities include conducting team meetings, managing project timelines, assessing resource needs, and overseeing budgets. You will interact closely with sponsors and work collaboratively with programmers and data management personnel to ensure proper database maintenance and documentation. Additionally, you will provide sample size calculations, review protocols for statistical soundness, and create randomization schemes. You will develop and implement statistical analysis plans, including analysis databases and table specifications, and guide the team in their execution. Hands-on programming skills, especially in SAS® (BASE, STAT, MACRO, and GRAPH), are essential, along with experience in reviewing reports and contributing to the statistical sections of clinical reports. Your role will also involve monitoring the project budget and proactively communicating changes in work scope. A Master's degree in statistics, biostatistics, or a related field is required, with significant experience leading project teams, conducting statistical analysis, and collaborating with cross-functional teams. Strong SAS® programming skills, the ability to mentor and lead teams, excellent project management abilities, and effective communication skills are essential for success in this role.

This role offers a unique opportunity to shape the future of the P&U sector while working in a dynamic, globally recognized consulting environment.

user2.value: We are looking for a talented and experienced Data Engineer specializing in Generative AI (Gen AI) to join our team. user2.value: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Statistician to join our clinical development team in the pharmaceutical industry. The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years of experience working in clinical development, with a strong foundation in statistics and quantitative methods. You should possess a deep understanding of clinical trial study design, including the application of appropriate statistical methods and the ability to implement simulations using tools such as R and SAS. This role may involve overseeing the statistical deliverables from both internal teams and external partners, such as Contract Research Organizations (CROs), ensuring accuracy and consistency in statistical analysis. Hands-on experience in statistical and programming work is required, as well as a solid knowledge of CDISC standards to ensure data is managed and reported in accordance with industry guidelines. A minimum of a Master's degree in Statistics, Biostatistics, or a related quantitative field is required, though a PhD is preferred. This role offers the opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge clinical trials, applying your expertise to improve the development of new treatments and therapies, while also ensuring the integrity and validity of data throughout the trial process. The position requires strong problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

user2.value: We are seeking a highly skilled and passionate Machine Learning Specialist to join our team, where you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge machine learning projects that push the boundaries of AI technology. In this role, you will apply advanced ML techniques to solve complex problems and drive innovation in specialized domains. Your responsibilities will include transforming data science prototypes, designing machine learning systems, researching and implementing appropriate ML algorithms, and developing applications based on specific requirements. You will be involved in selecting datasets, performing statistical analysis, and fine-tuning models to ensure optimal performance. Additionally, you will train and retrain systems when necessary, extend existing ML libraries, and stay updated on the latest developments in the field. The ideal candidate will have proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or a similar role, a solid understanding of data structures, data modeling, and software architecture, as well as deep knowledge of mathematics, probability, statistics, and algorithms. You should be proficient in programming languages like Python, Java, and R, and familiar with popular ML frameworks such as Keras, PyTorch, and libraries like scikit-learn. Strong communication skills, the ability to collaborate in a team environment, and exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities are essential. A BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field is required, and a Master’s degree is a plus.

user2.value: We are seeking an experienced and proactive Lead Statistician to independently manage and oversee statistical aspects of clinical development projects, with limited supervision. In this role, you will be responsible for leading project teams, developing analysis databases, conducting complex statistical analyses, and generating formatted tables and summaries. You will also play a key role in mentoring junior team members, ensuring that departmental SOPs are followed, and maintaining high-quality project documentation. Key responsibilities include conducting team meetings, managing project timelines, assessing resource needs, and overseeing budgets. You will interact closely with sponsors and work collaboratively with programmers and data management personnel to ensure proper database maintenance and documentation. Additionally, you will provide sample size calculations, review protocols for statistical soundness, and create randomization schemes. You will develop and implement statistical analysis plans, including analysis databases and table specifications, and guide the team in their execution. Hands-on programming skills, especially in SAS® (BASE, STAT, MACRO, and GRAPH), are essential, along with experience in reviewing reports and contributing to the statistical sections of clinical reports. Your role will also involve monitoring the project budget and proactively communicating changes in work scope. A Master's degree in statistics, biostatistics, or a related field is required, with significant experience leading project teams, conducting statistical analysis, and collaborating with cross-functional teams. Strong SAS® programming skills, the ability to mentor and lead teams, excellent project management abilities, and effective communication skills are essential for success in this role.

user2.value: We are looking for a skilled and experienced Data Engineer with a strong background in Python programming and a deep understanding of Azure services. The ideal candidate will have expertise in various ETL tools and a proven track record in data warehousing. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining Python code for diverse applications and data processes while leveraging Azure services like storage accounts, Azure Data Bricks, Azure Data Factory, Log Analytics, and Synapse. You will implement ETL processes using tools such as Azure Data Factory (ADF), Pyramid Analytics, SSIS, and Alteryx, and design, build, and manage data warehouses. Your responsibilities will also include developing and maintaining databases using SQL Server and Oracle, writing optimized SQL queries, and creating and managing reports through tools like Pyramid Analytics, Power BI, and Tableau. Additionally, experience with data file formats like Avro and Parquet will be essential for this role. The ideal candidate will bring strong coding skills in Python, hands-on experience with ETL tools, and proficiency in advanced SQL development. Familiarity with reporting tools like Power BI and Tableau, along with a solid understanding of database development, is highly desirable. If you are passionate about using your technical expertise to create robust data solutions in a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply.

Strong communication skills, the ability to collaborate in a team environment, and exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities are essential. A BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field is required, and a Master’s degree is a plus.

user2.value: We are seeking an experienced and proactive Lead Statistician to independently manage and oversee statistical aspects of clinical development projects, with limited supervision. In this role, you will be responsible for leading project teams, developing analysis databases, conducting complex statistical analyses, and generating formatted tables and summaries. You will also play a key role in mentoring junior team members, ensuring that departmental SOPs are followed, and maintaining high-quality project documentation. Key responsibilities include conducting team meetings, managing project timelines, assessing resource needs, and overseeing budgets. You will interact closely with sponsors and work collaboratively with programmers and data management personnel to ensure proper database maintenance and documentation. Additionally, you will provide sample size calculations, review protocols for statistical soundness, and create randomization schemes. You will develop and implement statistical analysis plans, including analysis databases and table specifications, and guide the team in their execution. Hands-on programming skills, especially in SAS® (BASE, STAT, MACRO, and GRAPH), are essential, along with experience in reviewing reports and contributing to the statistical sections of clinical reports. Your role will also involve monitoring the project budget and proactively communicating changes in work scope. A Master's degree in statistics, biostatistics, or a related field is required, with significant experience leading project teams, conducting statistical analysis, and collaborating with cross-functional teams. Strong SAS® programming skills, the ability to mentor and lead teams, excellent project management abilities, and effective communication skills are essential for success in this role.

user2.value: We are looking for a skilled and experienced Data Engineer with a strong background in Python programming and a deep understanding of Azure services. The ideal candidate will have expertise in various ETL tools and a proven track record in data warehousing. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining Python code for diverse applications and data processes while leveraging Azure services like storage accounts, Azure Data Bricks, Azure Data Factory, Log Analytics, and Synapse. You will implement ETL processes using tools such as Azure Data Factory (ADF), Pyramid Analytics, SSIS, and Alteryx, and design, build, and manage data warehouses. Your responsibilities will also include developing and maintaining databases using SQL Server and Oracle, writing optimized SQL queries, and creating and managing reports through tools like Pyramid Analytics, Power BI, and Tableau. Additionally, experience with data file formats like Avro and Parquet will be essential for this role. The ideal candidate will bring strong coding skills in Python, hands-on experience with ETL tools, and proficiency in advanced SQL development. Familiarity with reporting tools like Power BI and Tableau, along with a solid understanding of database development, is highly desirable. If you are passionate about using your technical expertise to create robust data solutions in a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply.

Strong communication, project management, and people management skills, along with a proactive, problem-solving mindset, are essential. This role offers a unique opportunity to shape the future of the P&U sector while working in a dynamic, globally recognized consulting environment.

user2.value: We are looking for a talented and experienced Data Engineer specializing in Generative AI (Gen AI) to join our team. The ideal candidate will have 5-8 years of hands-on experience with Python programming and be well-versed in building scalable, data-driven solutions in cloud environments, particularly with Azure. You should have solid experience in working with REST APIs, Fast APIs, Graph APIs, and SQL Alchemy for efficient data integration and management. A strong understanding of Azure services such as DataLake, Azure SQL, Function Apps, and Azure Cognitive Search is essential for this role. Additionally, you should be familiar with key concepts in Generative AI, including chunking, embeddings, vectorization, indexing, prompting, hallucinations, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG). Experience in DevOps practices, such as creating pull requests (PRs) and maintaining code repositories, is required. You will also be responsible for applying best practices in security and governance for Gen AI frameworks, ensuring compliance and data integrity. Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively within cross-functional teams are key to success in this role. This position offers an exciting opportunity to work on innovative AI projects and contribute to the development of cutting-edge data engineering solutions.

The position requires strong problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

user2.value: We are looking for a skilled and experienced Data Engineer with a strong background in Python programming and a deep understanding of Azure services. The ideal candidate will have expertise in various ETL tools and a proven track record in data warehousing. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining Python code for diverse applications and data processes while leveraging Azure services like storage accounts, Azure Data Bricks, Azure Data Factory, Log Analytics, and Synapse. You will implement ETL processes using tools such as Azure Data Factory (ADF), Pyramid Analytics, SSIS, and Alteryx, and design, build, and manage data warehouses. Your responsibilities will also include developing and maintaining databases using SQL Server and Oracle, writing optimized SQL queries, and creating and managing reports through tools like Pyramid Analytics, Power BI, and Tableau. Additionally, experience with data file formats like Avro and Parquet will be essential for this role. The ideal candidate will bring strong coding skills in Python, hands-on experience with ETL tools, and proficiency in advanced SQL development. Familiarity with reporting tools like Power BI and Tableau, along with a solid understanding of database development, is highly desirable. If you are passionate about using your technical expertise to create robust data solutions in a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply.

user1.value: This candidate has extensive experience in building scalable data pipelines using Python and Azure. user2.value: We are seeking a Senior Manager with expertise in the Power & Utilities (P&U) sector, covering areas such as Generation, Transmission, Distribution, Metering, Retail, Customer, and Trading, to join our team and play a key role in the growth of a new service offering. In this role, you will provide consulting services to P&U clients, leading Digital Grid Programs and systems such as ADMS, DMS, OMS, SCADA, and GIS, with a focus on increasing value and efficiency. You will act as an evangelist for Energy Efficiency, driving synergies with Smart Grid Technologies, Distributed Energy Resources, and Electric Vehicle Charging Infrastructure. The ideal candidate will possess a degree in Electrical Engineering, knowledge of power system modeling standards, and a minimum of 15 years of experience, with at least 10 years focused on the P&U sector. Strong communication, project management, and people management skills, along with a proactive, problem-solving mindset, are essential. This role offers a unique opportunity to shape the future of the P&U sector while working in a dynamic, globally recognized consulting environment.

user2.value: We are looking for a talented and experienced Data Engineer specializing in Generative AI (Gen AI) to join our team. The ideal candidate will have 5-8 years of hands-on experience with Python programming and be well-versed in building scalable, data-driven solutions in cloud environments, particularly with Azure. You should have solid experience in working with REST APIs, Fast APIs, Graph APIs, and SQL Alchemy for efficient data integration and management. A strong understanding of Azure services such as DataLake, Azure SQL, Function Apps, and Azure Cognitive Search is essential for this role. Additionally, you should be familiar with key concepts in Generative AI, including chunking, embeddings, vectorization, indexing, prompting, hallucinations, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG). Experience in DevOps practices, such as creating pull requests (PRs) and maintaining code repositories, is required. You will also be responsible for applying best practices in security and governance for Gen AI frameworks, ensuring compliance and data integrity. Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively within cross-functional teams are key to success in this role. This position offers an exciting opportunity to work on innovative AI projects and contribute to the development of cutting-edge data engineering solutions.

user2.value: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Statistician to join our clinical development team in the pharmaceutical industry. The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years of experience working in clinical development, with a strong foundation in statistics and quantitative methods. You should possess a deep understanding of clinical trial study design, including the application of appropriate statistical methods and the ability to implement simulations using tools such as R and SAS. This role may involve overseeing the statistical deliverables from both internal teams and external partners, such as Contract Research Organizations (CROs), ensuring accuracy and consistency in statistical analysis. Hands-on experience in statistical and programming work is required, as well as a solid knowledge of CDISC standards to ensure data is managed and reported in accordance with industry guidelines. A minimum of a Master's degree in Statistics, Biostatistics, or a related quantitative field is required, though a PhD is preferred. This role offers the opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge clinical trials, applying your expertise to improve the development of new treatments and therapies, while also ensuring the integrity and validity of data throughout the trial process. The position requires strong problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

Your role will also involve monitoring the project budget and proactively communicating changes in work scope. A Master's degree in statistics, biostatistics, or a related field is required, with significant experience leading project teams, conducting statistical analysis, and collaborating with cross-functional teams. In addition to their work with APIs, they have also gained significant experience in designing and deploying machine learning models for various applications, from recommendation systems to predictive analytics. user2.value: We are seeking an experienced and proactive Lead Statistician to independently manage and oversee statistical aspects of clinical development projects, with limited supervision. In this role, you will be responsible for leading project teams, developing analysis databases, conducting complex statistical analyses, and generating formatted tables and summaries. You will also play a key role in mentoring junior team members, ensuring that departmental SOPs are followed, and maintaining high-quality project documentation. Key responsibilities include conducting team meetings, managing project timelines, assessing resource needs, and overseeing budgets. You will interact closely with sponsors and work collaboratively with programmers and data management personnel to ensure proper database maintenance and documentation. Additionally, you will provide sample size calculations, review protocols for statistical soundness, and create randomization schemes. You will develop and implement statistical analysis plans, including analysis databases and table specifications, and guide the team in their execution. Hands-on programming skills, especially in SAS® (BASE, STAT, MACRO, and GRAPH), are essential, along with experience in reviewing reports and contributing to the statistical sections of clinical reports. Your role will also involve monitoring the project budget and proactively communicating changes in work scope. A Master's degree in statistics, biostatistics, or a related field is required, with significant experience leading project teams, conducting statistical analysis, and collaborating with cross-functional teams. Strong SAS® programming skills, the ability to mentor and lead teams, excellent project management abilities, and effective communication skills are essential for success in this role.

user2.value: We are actively seeking talented Senior Python Developers to join our dynamic team, dedicated to advancing the field of AI technology. This opportunity is perfect for professionals who are passionate about developing innovative solutions and aspire to be at the forefront of AI developments. As a Senior Python Developer, you will collaborate with various companies across the US, working on both commercial and research-driven AI solutions. Your role will involve writing efficient Python code to solve complex problems, using your business acumen and analytical skills to extract valuable insights from public databases. You will communicate the reasoning and logic behind your code clearly, especially when working in Jupyter notebooks or other appropriate mediums. Extensive experience in Python programming, a deep understanding of the language's syntax and conventions, and a strong background in tackling algorithmic problems are essential. The ideal candidate should also be able to design and implement practical solutions, develop test cases to validate those solutions, and debug and refine their work. While prior experience in Software Quality Assurance and Test Planning is a plus, excellent communication skills—both spoken and written—are a must for collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams. If you are eager to take on challenging projects in AI and machine learning, we encourage you to apply and contribute to our innovative and rapidly growing environment.

We are looking for a skilled and experienced Data Engineer with a strong background in Python programming and a deep understanding of Azure services. The ideal candidate will have expertise in various ETL tools and a proven track record in data warehousing. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining Python code for diverse applications and data processes while leveraging Azure services like storage accounts, Azure Data Bricks, Azure Data Factory, Log Analytics, and Synapse. You will implement ETL processes using tools such as Azure Data Factory (ADF), Pyramid Analytics, SSIS, and Alteryx, and design, build, and manage data warehouses. Your responsibilities will also include developing and maintaining databases using SQL Server and Oracle, writing optimized SQL queries, and creating and managing reports through tools like Pyramid Analytics, Power BI, and Tableau. Additionally, experience with data file formats like Avro and Parquet will be essential for this role. The ideal candidate will bring strong coding skills in Python, hands-on experience with ETL tools, and proficiency in advanced SQL development. Familiarity with reporting tools like Power BI and Tableau, along with a solid understanding of database development, is highly desirable. If you are passionate about using your technical expertise to create robust data solutions in a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply.

user1.value: We are seeking a Senior Manager with expertise in the Power & Utilities (P&U) sector, covering areas such as Generation, Transmission, Distribution, Metering, Retail, Customer, and Trading, to join our team and play a key role in the growth of a new service offering. In this role, you will provide consulting services to P&U clients, leading Digital Grid Programs and systems such as ADMS, DMS, OMS, SCADA, and GIS, with a focus on increasing value and efficiency. You will act as an evangelist for Energy Efficiency, driving synergies with Smart Grid Technologies, Distributed Energy Resources, and Electric Vehicle Charging Infrastructure. Additionally, you will stay current on industry trends, provide strategic insights, and contribute to new business development by developing solutions, managing workstreams, and leading client meetings and workshops. Your expertise will also be crucial in supporting business development activities, including go-to-market strategies, project management, and client relationship building. The role requires a deep understanding of the P&U lifecycle, extensive experience in sales enablement and program management, and a solid background in Smart Energy Solutions and Digital Utilities Transformation. The ideal candidate will possess a degree in Electrical Engineering, knowledge of power system modeling standards, and a minimum of 15 years of experience, with at least 10 years focused on the P&U sector. Strong communication, project management, and people management skills, along with a proactive, problem-solving mindset, are essential. This role offers a unique opportunity to shape the future of the P&U sector while working in a dynamic, globally recognized consulting environment.

We are looking for a talented and experienced Data Engineer specializing in Generative AI (Gen AI) to join our team. The ideal candidate will have 5-8 years of hands-on experience with Python programming and be well-versed in building scalable, data-driven solutions in cloud environments, particularly with Azure. You should have solid experience in working with REST APIs, Fast APIs, Graph APIs, and SQL Alchemy for efficient data integration and management. A strong understanding of Azure services such as DataLake, Azure SQL, Function Apps, and Azure Cognitive Search is essential for this role. Additionally, you should be familiar with key concepts in Generative AI, including chunking, embeddings, vectorization, indexing, prompting, hallucinations, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG). Experience in DevOps practices, such as creating pull requests (PRs) and maintaining code repositories, is required. You will also be responsible for applying best practices in security and governance for Gen AI frameworks, ensuring compliance and data integrity. Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively within cross-functional teams are key to success in this role. This position offers an exciting opportunity to work on innovative AI projects and contribute to the development of cutting-edge data engineering solutions.

The ideal candidate will have 5-8 years of hands-on experience with Python programming and be well-versed in building scalable, data-driven solutions in cloud environments, particularly with Azure. You should have solid experience in working with REST APIs, Fast APIs, Graph APIs, and SQL Alchemy for efficient data integration and management. Additionally, you should be familiar with key concepts in Generative AI, including chunking, embeddings, vectorization, indexing, prompting, hallucinations, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG). You will also be responsible for applying best practices in security and governance for Gen AI frameworks, ensuring compliance and data integrity. Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively within cross-functional teams are key to success in this role. This position offers an exciting opportunity to work on innovative AI projects and contribute to the development of cutting-edge data engineering solutions.

user1.value: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Statistician to join our clinical development team in the pharmaceutical industry. The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years of experience working in clinical development, with a strong foundation in statistics and quantitative methods. You should possess a deep understanding of clinical trial study design, including the application of appropriate statistical methods and the ability to implement simulations using tools such as R and SAS. This role may involve overseeing the statistical deliverables from both internal teams and external partners, such as Contract Research Organizations (CROs), ensuring accuracy and consistency in statistical analysis. Hands-on experience in statistical and programming work is required, as well as a solid knowledge of CDISC standards to ensure data is managed and reported in accordance with industry guidelines. A minimum of a Master's degree in Statistics, Biostatistics, or a related quantitative field is required, though a PhD is preferred. This role offers the opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge clinical trials, applying your expertise to improve the development of new treatments and therapies, while also ensuring the integrity and validity of data throughout the trial process. The position requires strong problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

user1.value: We are seeking a highly skilled and passionate Machine Learning Specialist to join our team, where you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge machine learning projects that push the boundaries of AI technology. Your responsibilities will include transforming data science prototypes, designing machine learning systems, researching and implementing appropriate ML algorithms, and developing applications based on specific requirements. A BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field is required, and a Master’s degree is a plus.

user1.value: We are seeking a highly skilled and passionate Machine Learning Specialist to join our team, where you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge machine learning projects that push the boundaries of AI technology. In this role, you will apply advanced ML techniques to solve complex problems and drive innovation in specialized domains. Your responsibilities will include transforming data science prototypes, designing machine learning systems, researching and implementing appropriate ML algorithms, and developing applications based on specific requirements. You will be involved in selecting datasets, performing statistical analysis, and fine-tuning models to ensure optimal performance. Additionally, you will train and retrain systems when necessary, extend existing ML libraries, and stay updated on the latest developments in the field. The ideal candidate will have proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or a similar role, a solid understanding of data structures, data modeling, and software architecture, as well as deep knowledge of mathematics, probability, statistics, and algorithms. You should be proficient in programming languages like Python, Java, and R, and familiar with popular ML frameworks such as Keras, PyTorch, and libraries like scikit-learn. Strong communication skills, the ability to collaborate in a team environment, and exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities are essential. A BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field is required, and a Master’s degree is a plus.

We are seeking an experienced and proactive Lead Statistician to independently manage and oversee statistical aspects of clinical development projects, with limited supervision. In this role, you will be responsible for leading project teams, developing analysis databases, conducting complex statistical analyses, and generating formatted tables and summaries. You will also play a key role in mentoring junior team members, ensuring that departmental SOPs are followed, and maintaining high-quality project documentation. Key responsibilities include conducting team meetings, managing project timelines, assessing resource needs, and overseeing budgets. You will interact closely with sponsors and work collaboratively with programmers and data management personnel to ensure proper database maintenance and documentation. Additionally, you will provide sample size calculations, review protocols for statistical soundness, and create randomization schemes. You will develop and implement statistical analysis plans, including analysis databases and table specifications, and guide the team in their execution. Hands-on programming skills, especially in SAS® (BASE, STAT, MACRO, and GRAPH), are essential, along with experience in reviewing reports and contributing to the statistical sections of clinical reports. Your role will also involve monitoring the project budget and proactively communicating changes in work scope. A Master's degree in statistics, biostatistics, or a related field is required, with significant experience leading project teams, conducting statistical analysis, and collaborating with cross-functional teams. Strong SAS® programming skills, the ability to mentor and lead teams, excellent project management abilities, and effective communication skills are essential for success in this role.

Unified Mentor is offering an exciting internship opportunity for a Data Analyst Intern, providing students and recent graduates with valuable hands-on experience in data analysis. This remote, 3-month unpaid internship will allow you to assist in collecting, cleaning, and analyzing data sets, collaborate with the data analysis team to identify trends and patterns, and contribute to the development of data visualization dashboards and reports. You will also support in creating presentations to communicate findings to stakeholders and have the opportunity to learn and utilize various data analysis tools and techniques. To be eligible, you should be currently enrolled in or recently graduated from a relevant academic program, possess strong analytical skills with attention to detail, and have proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, or Python (preferred but not required). Excellent communication, teamwork skills, and the ability to work independently are essential. Upon successful completion of the internship, you will receive a certificate and a letter of recommendation, along with the possibility of a full-time employment offer based on performance. This internship is a great opportunity to gain hands-on experience, contribute to real projects, and build your professional portfolio.

We are seeking a highly skilled and passionate Machine Learning Specialist to join our team, where you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge machine learning projects that push the boundaries of AI technology. In this role, you will apply advanced ML techniques to solve complex problems and drive innovation in specialized domains. Your responsibilities will include transforming data science prototypes, designing machine learning systems, researching and implementing appropriate ML algorithms, and developing applications based on specific requirements. You will be involved in selecting datasets, performing statistical analysis, and fine-tuning models to ensure optimal performance. Additionally, you will train and retrain systems when necessary, extend existing ML libraries, and stay updated on the latest developments in the field. The ideal candidate will have proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or a similar role, a solid understanding of data structures, data modeling, and software architecture, as well as deep knowledge of mathematics, probability, statistics, and algorithms. You should be proficient in programming languages like Python, Java, and R, and familiar with popular ML frameworks such as Keras, PyTorch, and libraries like scikit-learn. Strong communication skills, the ability to collaborate in a team environment, and exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities are essential. A BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field is required, and a Master’s degree is a plus.

Unified Mentor is offering an exciting internship opportunity for a Data Analyst Intern, providing students and recent graduates with valuable hands-on experience in data analysis. This remote, 3-month unpaid internship will allow you to assist in collecting, cleaning, and analyzing data sets, collaborate with the data analysis team to identify trends and patterns, and contribute to the development of data visualization dashboards and reports. You will also support in creating presentations to communicate findings to stakeholders and have the opportunity to learn and utilize various data analysis tools and techniques. To be eligible, you should be currently enrolled in or recently graduated from a relevant academic program, possess strong analytical skills with attention to detail, and have proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, or Python (preferred but not required). Excellent communication, teamwork skills, and the ability to work independently are essential. Upon successful completion of the internship, you will receive a certificate and a letter of recommendation, along with the possibility of a full-time employment offer based on performance. This internship is a great opportunity to gain hands-on experience, contribute to real projects, and build your professional portfolio.

user2.value: We are seeking a Senior Manager with expertise in the Power & Utilities (P&U) sector, covering areas such as Generation, Transmission, Distribution, Metering, Retail, Customer, and Trading, to join our team and play a key role in the growth of a new service offering. In this role, you will provide consulting services to P&U clients, leading Digital Grid Programs and systems such as ADMS, DMS, OMS, SCADA, and GIS, with a focus on increasing value and efficiency. You will act as an evangelist for Energy Efficiency, driving synergies with Smart Grid Technologies, Distributed Energy Resources, and Electric Vehicle Charging Infrastructure. Additionally, you will stay current on industry trends, provide strategic insights, and contribute to new business development by developing solutions, managing workstreams, and leading client meetings and workshops. Your expertise will also be crucial in supporting business development activities, including go-to-market strategies, project management, and client relationship building. The role requires a deep understanding of the P&U lifecycle, extensive experience in sales enablement and program management, and a solid background in Smart Energy Solutions and Digital Utilities Transformation. The ideal candidate will possess a degree in Electrical Engineering, knowledge of power system modeling standards, and a minimum of 15 years of experience, with at least 10 years focused on the P&U sector. Strong communication, project management, and people management skills, along with a proactive, problem-solving mindset, are essential. This role offers a unique opportunity to shape the future of the P&U sector while working in a dynamic, globally recognized consulting environment.

user2.value: We are seeking an experienced and proactive Lead Statistician to independently manage and oversee statistical aspects of clinical development projects, with limited supervision. In this role, you will be responsible for leading project teams, developing analysis databases, conducting complex statistical analyses, and generating formatted tables and summaries. You will also play a key role in mentoring junior team members, ensuring that departmental SOPs are followed, and maintaining high-quality project documentation. Key responsibilities include conducting team meetings, managing project timelines, assessing resource needs, and overseeing budgets. You will interact closely with sponsors and work collaboratively with programmers and data management personnel to ensure proper database maintenance and documentation. Additionally, you will provide sample size calculations, review protocols for statistical soundness, and create randomization schemes. You will develop and implement statistical analysis plans, including analysis databases and table specifications, and guide the team in their execution. Hands-on programming skills, especially in SAS® (BASE, STAT, MACRO, and GRAPH), are essential, along with experience in reviewing reports and contributing to the statistical sections of clinical reports. Your role will also involve monitoring the project budget and proactively communicating changes in work scope. A Master's degree in statistics, biostatistics, or a related field is required, with significant experience leading project teams, conducting statistical analysis, and collaborating with cross-functional teams. Strong SAS® programming skills, the ability to mentor and lead teams, excellent project management abilities, and effective communication skills are essential for success in this role.
